Posts.Content: FeMichelle wrote: I was just diagnosed on June 6, 2016 Stage: 1 Grade: 3 HER2- positive ER/PR- positive The last 5 days has been hard --- still in processing phase Feeling overwhelm , scared, and unsure if i will make the right choice regarding my treatment options. Dx 6/6/2016, IDC, Left, 1cm, Stage 0, Grade 3, ER+/PR+, HER2+ (IHC) Surgery 7/15/2016 Mastectomy: Left Chemotherapy Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed FeMichelle

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2016 02:11AM FeMichelle wrote: Welcome, Your among friends. I was diagnosed June 6 2016 I'm still in a phase of disbelief. I've been trying to figure out what surgery or treatment paths I want to take. This is the most difficult decision I've ever had to make, and your absolutely correct regarding this being an energy drainer This site had been very supportive, helpful and very informative to all my questions and concerns.

Posts.Title: I'm new to this Acie sschreier

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2016 11:15PM - edited Jun 21, 2016 02:15AM by FeMichelle Hello Acie, I am triple positive ER/PR and HER2..... Today I called my Breast Care Coordinator to let her know I had chosen my surgery after carefull consideration I've elected to have a mastectomy. Now I'm waiting for the next step...I'm so confused because I haven't seen anyone besides the surgeon and the BCC I don't no who my Oncologist is.I don't know what's next for me, my recovery, NOTHING I'M CLUELESS.....
Posts.Title: I'm new to this Acie sschreier
How long after diagnosis did you have to wait for treatment? Blueorange nye1980

Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2016 08:07AM FeMichelle wrote: Thank you Tvler for posting your comment it really helped me out. I was diagnosed June 6, 2016 I've met with the surgeon, who advised me of my options lumpectomy with radiation therapy or a mastectomy. I finally made a choice of mastectomy yesterday after 2 weeks of trying to really grasp whatttttttt is really happening to me. I feel like a deer caught in the headlights. The surgical staff set me up with my Breast Care Coordinator ' I'm still CLUELESS of what's next!
Posts.Title: How long after diagnosis did you have to wait for treatment? Blueorange nye1980

Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2016 11:41AM FeMichelle wrote: My reason for the Mastectomy was listening to family members tell me, I should just have the breast removed to guarantee my chances of not returning. I'm so confused with no real help
